videos.title: NumberPower Presents: Numbaland!
videos.description: Come to Numbaland.com to try out all of our games and learn about the academic research that inspires them

videos.title: NumberPower presents: Battleship Numberline
videos.description: A number sense game that is part of Numbaland. Come visit Numbaland.com to see the rest of the games and learn about the academic research that supports these games.

videos.title: Hanuman Quiz Adventure
videos.description: Incomplete: included in the Playpower.org 3-in-1 cartridge

videos.title: Malaria Game
videos.description: Incomplete, but found on the Playpower.org 3-in-1 demo game cartridge.

videos.title: "Hanuman, Typing Warrior" Game User Testing - Household BC
videos.description: Playpower.org produces learning games for a $10 computer in India. This video shows our game user testing with three girls playing "Hanuman, Typing Warrior" in a household with an income level of less than $100/month for a family of 5.

videos.title: "Hanuman, Typing Warrior" Game User Testing - Household BL
videos.description: Playpower.org produces learning games for a $10 computer in India. This video shows our game user testing with two girls playing "Hanuman, Typing Warrior" in a household with an income level of about $100/month for a family of 4. Notice that the girls start saying each letter out loud. This occurred in many other households as well.

videos.title: "Hanuman, Typing Warrior" Game User Testing - Household BL (alternating)
videos.description: Playpower.org produces learning games for a $10 computer in India. This video shows our game user testing with two girls playing "Hanuman, Typing Warrior" in a household with an income level of about $100/month for a family of 4. Notice that the girls created their own game within the game, where each girl alternates pressing the keys.

videos.title: Hanuman, Typing Warrior: A Worked Example from Playpower.org
videos.description: Playpower.org is an open-source community that makes learning games for low-cost (~$10) computer platforms that are widely sold to low-income families in developing countries. This game was developed in 6502 assembly code for a keyboard-based 8-bit Nintendo Famicom clone, which are widely sold in India for ~$10. (Meaning: this game would run on an 8-bit Nintendo Entertainment System, if it had a keyboard) Each level is only 16Kb with 8kb of graphics.

videos.title: $10 Educational Computer
videos.description: Shows some of the educational games that come with a $10 educational computer, for sale in India

videos.title: Pushing buttons in Dharavi
videos.description: Found some kids playing video games in this little tiny arcade in Dharavi, which is supposedly Asia's largest slum

videos.title: Space Ganesh
videos.description: This is footage from Ganpati, the festival for everyone's favorite elephant god, Ganesh.

videos.title: Krishna's Birthday
videos.description: Shows the excellent use of glitter graphics on Hindu devotional television, Krishna's Birthday celebration, a truck that is probably exceeding the legal limit of occupants, and my first motorcycle ride in Bombay

videos.title: Street Tattoo
videos.description: Using a chain of Batteries, ladies will give you a really unhygenic tattoo on the streets of Bombay! This is at the Bandra Street Fair, for the Festival of Mount Mary.

videos.title: Heavy Metal in Mumbai
videos.description: So heavy metal is the most popular genre of live music it seems. Here is a glammed up nagalander (boomerang) busting up the crowd. But first the crowd shouts some nasty hindi at him because the concert is late to start.

videos.title: Electronics Shopping in the Monsoon
videos.description: We needed to find some specialized components for the Sewing Machine Mobile Phone Charger, so we headed down to Lamington Road, in Bombay, India. It was way more exciting than going to Radioshack.

videos.title: Commuting in Bombay Monsoon
videos.description: Commuting to Work in Bombay is more exciting than any disney ride, guaranteed.

videos.title: Bombay Traffic in the Monsoon
videos.description: Going to work is an adventure when it rains... Flooded roads

videos.title: sewing machine mobile phone charger
videos.description: Using some random parts found around bombay, we hacked together a footpowered sewing machine so that it can charge a mobile phone. Since there are footpowered sewing machines in nearly every village in India, this setup might help people stay connected even when the power goes out for days at a time. More at www.revolv.in hack, india, mobile phones, electricity

videos.title: real time lapse
videos.description: A portable camera tower allows aerial capture of crowd movements at etech's Make Fest. The crowd was able to see a real-time time-lapse of their own activity at 10x speed.
